clear rune: When used, copies the effect of the Rune or Soul stone you are holding (like the Blank Card) Drops a random rune on the floor when picked up The recharge time of this item depends on the Rune/Soul Stone held: 1 room: Soul of Lazarus 2 rooms: Rune of Ansuz, Rune of Berkano, Rune of Hagalaz, Soul of Cain 3 rooms: Rune of Algiz, Blank Rune, Soul of Magdalene, Soul of Judas, Soul of ???, Soul of the Lost 4 rooms: Rune of Ehwaz, Rune of Perthro, Black Rune, Soul of Isaac, Soul of Eden, Soul of the Forgotten, Soul of Jacob and Esau 6 rooms: Rune of Dagaz, Soul of Samson, Soul of Azazel, Soul of Apollyon, Soul of Bethany 12 rooms: Rune of Jera, Soul of Lilith Type: Active Recharge time: Varies Item Pool: Secret Room, Crane Game
mucormycosis: Tears have a chance to fire a fungus tear that sticks to enemies. It grows rapidly in size then explode into a gas cloud that damages nearby enemies When the explosion happens, more fungus tears fire out in random directions. Those tears will cause the same effect if they happen to hit other enemies Effects that replace your tears such as Brimstone simply have a chance to apply this effect Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room
2spooky: Any enemies that come within close range of Isaac will become feared, which causes them to flee Type: Passive Item Pool: Devil Room
golden razor: When used, this item takes away 5 of your coins and gives a +1.2 Damage Up that lasts for the current room Type: Active Recharge time: Instant Item Pool: Item Room, Greed Mode Item Room
sulfur: Upon use, grants use of Brimstone for the current room If used twice in the same room, the brimstone laser becomes massive and deals double damage More than two activations in the same room gives no further benefit Type: Active Recharge time: 3 rooms Item Pool: Devil Room
fortune cookie: Upon use, displays a random fortune and has a chance to drop a random consumable, which can be either a soul heart, a card (including dice shards, souls etc.), rune or trinket Type: Active Recharge time: 2 rooms Item Pool: Item Room
eye sore: With each tear fired, you have a chance to fire up to three extra tears in random directions The extra tears scale with your other damage increasing items Synergises with other items that replace your tears, like Brimstone or Technology Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room
120 volt: This item will fire electricity at nearby enemies, dealing roughly 135% of your tear damage rapidly The electricity can chain onto other nearby enemies if they are close enough Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room
it hurts: Taking damage causes Isaac to fire a circle of tears around him, each dealing 10 damage After taking damage, you also gain a +1.2 Tears Up for the rest of the current room. Any subsequent hits give +0.4 Tears Up Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room
almond milk: Greatly increases tears (x4 fire rate) Greatly decreases damage (x0.33 damage multiplier) Individual tears gain random worm effects (e.g. Hook Worm, Wiggle Worm etc.) Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room
rock bottom: Prevents stats from being reduced any more for the rest of the run e.g. Stat Down pills do nothing, and items like Experimental Treatment increase stats but don't reduce any Damage multipliers are still applied from items such as Soy Milk Type: Passive Item Pool: Secret Room
nancy bombs: +5 Bombs Bombs now explode with a random effect (e.g. Poison, Homing, Prize Bombs) Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room
a bar of soap: +0.5 Tears Up +0.2 Shot Speed Up Type: Passive Item Pool: Boss Room
blood puppy: Spawns a red worm familiar that chases enemies nearby around the room and deals 2 contact damage per tick Type: Passive, Familiar Item Pool: Item Room, Red Chest, Curse Room
dream catcher: During the transition between floors, this item shows you a preview of the item that will spawn in the item room, and the boss that will appear Type: Passive Item Pool: Shop
paschal candle: Gives +0.4 Tears Up for each room completed without taking damage, up to a maximum of +2.0 Tears Up Picking this item up counts and gives you a temporary +0.4 Tears Up as well When you take damage, all stat upgrades given by this item are reset Type: Passive Item Pool: Angel Room
divine intervention: Allows you to double-tap the shoot button to create a holy shield that pushes enemies back and deals 10 damage to them if they touch it The shield also reflects enemy shots back at them for some extra damage Can only be activated every 3 seconds (Shown by a white glow and a ticking noise) Type: Passive Item Pool: Angel Room
blood oath: At the beginning of each new floor, this item will stab Isaac and reduce your red health down to half a heart. In exchange it gives you +0.05 Speed Up and Damage Up for every half a heart this item removes The amount of Damage Up scales higher the more hearts that are removed If Isaac is already at half a red heart when stabbed, no damage or speed increases are given The damage from being stabbed can be avoided with invincibility, however no damage or speed stat increases are gained if you do Type: Passive Item Pool: Devil Room, Curse Room
playdough cookie: Your individual tears each gain a random effect (e.g. Fear, Charm, Poison, Homing, Fire etc.) Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room
orphan socks: +2 Soul Hearts +0.3 Speed Up Allows you to walk on harmful floor effects without taking damage (e.g. spikes, creep) Type: Passive Item Pool: Secret Room
eye of the occult: Tears can be controlled mid-flight using the directional keys +1 Damage Up +2.0 Range Up -0.16 Shot Speed Down Type: Passive Item Pool: Devil Room
immaculate heart: In addition to regular tears, Isaac will sometimes fire extra tears that orbit around him +1 HP up +20% damage multiplier (x1.2) Type: Passive Item Pool: Angel Room
monstrance: Isaac now emits a large light aura that damages nearby enemies The visual effect is similar to the effect given to tears by the GodHead item The aura deals more damage towards the center Type: Passive Item Pool: Angel Room
the intruder: In addition to normal tears, Isaac now also fires a set of 4 quadshot tears with a slowing effect The quadshot tears deal 1.5 damage each and do not scale with your damage upgrades Upon taking damage, you have a chance to dislodge the spider from your face. It leaps at enemies, dealing contact damage and firing quad shots at them Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room
dirty mind: Each time you destroy part of a poop, this item will spawn 0-3 friendly Dip familiars that follow you and attack nearby enemies Different poop types will spawn different types of Dip, each with their own effect Golden poop dips can petrify enemies, turning them to gold for a few seconds. If the enemy dies while in this state they will drop 1-4 coins Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room
damocles: When used, places a sword directly above Isaac's head and while active will spawn an extra item for every item pedestal spawned After getting hit once with the item activated, at any time without warning, the sword may fall, instantly killing Isaac regardless of his health Taking more hits will make the sword more likely to fall down Using Blood Donation Machines, IV Bag, or Devil Beggars does not increase the chance for the sword to fall Items with a price (i.e. in shops or devil rooms) will spawn the extra item free of charge The chance for Damocles to fall is indicated by how far the sword swings back and forth The only way to survive the falling sword is either through extra lives, by using items that would make you invincible, such as Gnawed Leaf or playing as The Lost. After the sword falls, extra items will no longer spawn Type: Active Recharge time: One time use Item Pool: Devil Room, Secret Room
free lemonade: Upon use, spawns a giant puddle of lemonade that deals 6 damage per tick to any enemies which come in contact with it Effectively the same effect as the Lemon Party pill Type: Active Recharge time: 4 rooms Item Pool: Item Room
spirit sword: Your tears are replaced with a sword which can be swung to deal damage Holding any fire button charges a spin attack. The spin attack does rough x2.7 more than the regular sword slash While at full red health you also shoot a projectile across the room with each swing (similar to the Master Sword in Zelda) Type: Passive Item Pool: Angel Room
red key: While held, a red outline of a door will appear on certain walls. Using the Red Key near it will spawn a red room This room will randomly choose from many types, including (but not limited to) any regular room from that floor, treasure rooms, curse rooms, devil rooms, angel rooms, I AM ERROR rooms and more In rooms with multiple door outlines, the closest one will be opened Attempting to create a room outside the maximum boundary (13 x 13 rooms) of the map will take you to an I AM ERROR room. You can't use the Red Key to leave this room The Red Key can be used to open the secret room in the Home floor, which is the method for unlocking alternative 'Tainted' characters Type: Active Recharge time: 3 rooms Item Pool: Secret Room, Red Chest, Curse Room, Key Beggar, Mom's Chest
psy fly: Gives Isaac an orbital fly, that will punch incoming tears back at the enemy, then deal contact damage to it briefly Type: Passive, Familiar Item Pool: Item Room, Key Beggar
wavy cap: Every time you use Wavy Cap, it gives +0.75 Tears Up and -0.03 Speed Down for the current floor Also when used, this item will distort the screen and sound slightly, stacking every time you use it All of these effects stack for the rest of the floor, meaning if used too many times the screen will be distorted so much it becomes unplayable This item was called Black Mushroom in Antibirth Type: Active Recharge time: Starts at 1 second, increasing by 1 second every time you use it Item Pool: Secret Room
rocket in a jar: +5 Bombs Your bombs now become rocket powered and will fly in the direction Isaac is facing Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room, Bomb Beggar
book of virtues: Upon use, spawns a flame familiar that fires spectral tears and deals contact damage to enemies. After taking two hits, the fire will be extinguished The Book can be held at the same time as another active item. When used, this will combine with your other active item, creating a unique flame and possibly giving special effects The recharge time of this item is based on your 2nd active item, otherwise it's 4 rooms While held, guarantees the first Devil/Angel Room encountered to be an Angel Room, and increases the overall chance of getting one A maximum of 16 flames can be active at one time around Isaac Counts as 1 of 3 book items needed towards the Bookworm transformation Type: Active/Passive Item Recharge time: Varies Item Pool: Angel Room, Library
alabaster box: A single use active item that will spawn 3 soul hearts and 2 items from the Angel Room pool Starts fully uncharged and gains charges through soul, black and immortal hearts. (6 full hearts to fully charge) Unless fully charged, hearts picked up are consumed by the Alabaster Box, instead of being added to your life total Type: Active Recharge time: 12 charges (one time use) Item Pool: Shop
the stairway: Spawns a ladder in the starting room of all future floors, which leads to the Angel Room Angel rooms accessed by The Stairway are different - They sell angel room items and soul hearts for money, similar to the Shop In Antibirth this was called Jacob's Ladder, which had to be renamed as Afterbirth+ already had an item with this name Type: Passive Item Pool: Angel Room
sol: Permanently shows the location of the boss room on the map After defeating the boss fight, this item will activate a use of the Sun card (full heal and map reveal), fully recharge your active item, remove curses from the floor, gives +3 Damage Up and +1 Luck up for the rest of the floor Only available inside a Planetarium - a room that has a base 1% chance to appear, which increases by +20% whenever you skip an Item Room (Must not enter to count as skipped) Type: Passive Item Pool: Planetarium
luna: Adds one extra secret room and one extra super secret room to each floor Each secret room contains a beam of light, that gives a Tears Up and a Soul heart for the rest of the floor. These stack with multiple secret rooms - The first one gives +1.00 Tears Up and a full soul heart, then all future ones give +0.5 and half a soul heart each. Reveals the location of one secret room on the minimap. Only available inside a Planetarium - a room that has a base 1% chance to appear, which increases by +20% whenever you skip an Item Room (Must not enter to count as skipped) Type: Passive Item Pool: Planetarium
mercurius: +0.40 Speed Up Doors remain open when entering a room with enemies in it. This means you can leave rooms before defeating the enemies inside Doesn't open locked doors, or the door that leads to the Boss Room Only available inside a Planetarium - a room that has a base 1% chance to appear, which increases by +20% whenever you skip an Item Room (Must not enter to count as skipped) Type: Passive Item Pool: Planetarium
venus: +1 HP Up This item causes nearby enemies to be affected by the charm effect, causing them to attack other nearby enemies The charm effect will wear off very quicky when enemies move away from Isaac Only available inside a Planetarium - a room that has a base 1% chance to appear, which increases by +20% whenever you skip an Item Room (Must not enter to count as skipped) Type: Passive Item Pool: Planetarium
terra: This item causes your tears to become rocks, which have increased knockback and can break other rocks and objects +1.0 Damage Up, but each tear has a random damage modifier that can go up or down Only available inside a Planetarium - a room that has a base 1% chance to appear, which increases by +20% whenever you skip an Item Room (Must not enter to count as skipped) Type: Passive Item Pool: Planetarium
mars: Allows Isaac to charge by double tapping the same direction, dealing damage to any enemies caught You are invincible while charging Can be used multiple times per room The dash deals x4 your current tear damage Doesn't have to be in a straight line, you can hold another button to curve it Has a 3 second cooldown before it can be used again Only available inside a Planetarium - a room that has a base 1% chance to appear, which increases by +20% whenever you skip an Item Room (Must not enter to count as skipped) Type: Passive Item Pool: Planetarium
jupiter: Gives +0.2 Speed Up, but every time you move your speed rapidly goes down by -0.5. While your speed is decreasing, Isaac will fart around the room, spawning poison gas clouds The farts stop spawning once you reach the minimum movement speed caused by this item Poison deals damage equal to half your tears Only available inside a Planetarium - a room that has a base 1% chance to appear, which increases by +20% whenever you skip an Item Room (Must not enter to count as skipped) Type: Passive Item Pool: Planetarium
saturnus: Gives you a wide aura which grants 7 orbital tears upon entering a new room The tears orbit for 13 seconds before dropping off Has a chance to absorb any enemy tears and add them to the orbiting tears. They can be used to damage enemies Only available inside a Planetarium - a room that has a base 1% chance to appear, which increases by +20% whenever you skip an Item Room (Must not enter to count as skipped) Type: Passive Item Pool: Planetarium
uranus: Isaac now shoots ice tears that slow enemies. Enemies that are killed by the ice tears will become frozen Frozen enemies never unfreeze and are considered dead by the game. Kicking a frozen enemy will push it into the wall, where it shatters and fires ice shards everywhere (these can then freeze other enemies) Only available inside a Planetarium - a room that has a base 1% chance to appear, which increases by +20% whenever you skip an Item Room (Must not enter to count as skipped) Type: Passive Item Pool: Planetarium
neptunus: Isaac will now automatically charge up tears, allowing you to store them up and fire them rapidly for a short time Any time you aren't firing tears, the charge bar will start filling up, for up to 3 seconds. Holding down the fire button again will quickly release all stored teared Only available inside a Planetarium - a room that has a base 1% chance to appear, which increases by +20% whenever you skip an Item Room (Must not enter to count as skipped) Type: Passive Item Pool: Planetarium
pluto: +0.72 Tears Up Greatly reduce Isaac's size, to an extent where enemy tears will now travel straight over him without dealing damage if you're standing close enough. Tears can still hit Isaac if gravity applies for too long Only available inside a Planetarium - a room that has a base 1% chance to appear, which increases by +20% whenever you skip an Item Room (Must not enter to count as skipped) Type: Passive Item Pool: Planetarium
voodoo head: This item has a chance to spawn additional curse rooms on each future floor Type: Passive Item Pool: Shop, Crane Game
eye drops: Tears Up Each of Isaac's eyes now fires at differing rates, giving an overall increase to rate of fire Type: Passive Item Pool: Boss Room
act of contrition: +1 Eternal Heart +0.7 Tears Up Allows Angel Rooms even if a Devil deal has been taken before Type: Passive Item Pool: Angel Room
member card: All shops now contain a trapdoor with a ladder, which leads down to a special shop The special shop contains various consumables and items at a higher price which are not necessarily from the normal Shop item pool Items cost 20c, trinkets cost 15c, consumables cost 7c Type: Passive Item Pool: Shop
battery pack: When picked up, this item fully recharges your currently held active item and drops between 2-4 battery pickups. These can be smaller or big batteries Type: Passive Item Pool: Battery Beggar
mom's bracelet: Upon use, Mom's Bracelet allows you to grab objects in the room and throw them, damaging any enemies which are hit Objects include pots, rocks etc Counts as 1 of 3 mom items needed towards the Mom transformation Type: Active Recharge time: 1 second Item Pool: Shop, Crane Game, Mom's Chest
the scooper: When used, this item spawns a Peeper familiar for the current room, which deals 12 contact damage per tick to enemies and leaves red creep in its path Type: Active Recharge time: 3 rooms Item Pool: Item Room
ocular rift: Fired tears now have a chance to summon a rift when they land on the ground The spawned rift sucks in enemies, projectiles and pickups and deals damage to enemies caught inside The size of the rift scales with your tear damage In Antibirth this item was called Oculus Rift Type: Passive Item Pool: Devil Room
boiled baby: A familiar boil that randomly fires bursts of tears, similar to the Boil enemy Type: Passive, Familiar Item Pool: Item Room/p>
freezer baby: A familiar baby that fires tears which have a chance to freeze enemies Frozen enemies never unfreeze and are considered dead by the game. Kicking a frozen enemy will push it into the wall, where it shatters and fires ice shards everywhere (these can then freeze other enemies) Counts as 1 of 3 familiar items needed towards the Conjoined transformation Type: Passive, Familiar Item Pool: Item Room
eternal d6: Upon use this item acts identical to the D6 item, however the item also has a 50% chance to disappear The chance to delete the item scales with your Luck stat, at +10 Luck the chance goes all the way down to 5% In the game files this item is called 'Florians Dice', which is a reference to the Eternal update for the original Binding of Isaac game, which changed the D6 to act as this item does Type: Active Recharge time: 2 rooms Item Pool: Item Room, Secret Room, Crane Game
bird cage: Taking damage for the first time in a room spawns a familiar which targets an enemy and jumps on them, releasing a rock wave outwards For the remainder of the room the familiar then continues to attack enemies similar to the Dead Bird item Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room
larynx: When used, this item does a shout-type attack, with its effect increasing in damage and size the more charges you have Larynx can be used with any number of charges. At 1 charge it deals 48 damage to any enemies close to Isaac. At the full 12 charges Isaac does a massive shout, dealing 356 damage to all enemies on the screen Type: Active Recharge time: 12 rooms (Can be used with partial charges) Item Pool: Item Room, Greed Mode Item Room
lost soul:
This item gives you a familiar version of The Lost character which dies instantly upon hit If the familiar survives an entire floor you get a random item Regenerates at the start of each floor if dead<./p>
			UNLOCK: Unlock this item by defeating Mother in the Corpse II as The Lost

Type: Passive, Familiar
Item Pool: Item Room, Secret Room

 Type: Passive, Familiar Item Pool: Item Room, Secret Room
blood bombs: +1 HP up Restores 5 empty red heart containers Bombs now spawn a puddle of red creep upon explosion While at 0 bombs, you can also place further bombs now at the cost of 1/2 of a heart. This will kill The Lost if used Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room
lil dumpy: A familiar that floats around and farts when touched by an enemy, which deals damage to nearby enemies and confuses them for a few seconds Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room
bird's eye: You have a chance alongside each tear to shoot a red flame, which deals damage to enemies that come in contact with it Damage starts at x4 your current tear damage, and scales down each time an enemy touches the fire The chance to create a fire scales with your Luck stat, at +11 Luck you shoot one with every tear Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room
lodestone: Tears now have a chance to cause enemies to be magnetized, Magnetized enemies attract other enemies, tears (including Isaac's) and enemy projectiles, Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room, Crane Game
rotten tomato: You have a chance to fire a tear that marks enemies red Marked enemies will be attacked by other enemies either until it is killed or it kills all the other enemies attacking it Chance to fire a marking tear scales with your luck stat Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room, Rotten Beggar
birthright: This item has a different effect for each character. See previous icon for normal character effects Tainted Isaac - Adds 4 more spaces for items Tainted Maggy - Adds 1 extra real heart container that doesn't deplete Tainted Cain - Doubles picks dropped when touching an item Tainted Judas - Unknown Tainted ??? - Allows you to hold up to 29 poops Tainted Eve - Unknown Tainted Samson - Chaining kills adds 3 seconds to the Berserk timer instead of 1 Tainted Azazel - Doubles his sneeze size Tainted Lazarus - Unknown Tainted Eden - Items taken before Birthright no longer get rerolled when taking damage Tainted Lost - Grants an extra life. Deals 200 damage to nearby enemies when reviving Tainted Lilith - Unknown Tainted Keeper - Nearby coins dropped by enemies move towards you quickly Tainted Apollyon - Unknown Tainted Forgotten - Grants the Recall ability. When used it sends the Forgotten skull back to you Tainted Bethany - Activating an item using soul charges is sometimes free Tainted Jacob - Unknown Type: Passive Item Pool: Shop
red stew: Fully heals all red heart containers Significantly increases damage (around +21), however the damage boost wears off slowly over time at a rate of roughly -0.04 per second Every enemy you kill adds +0.02 Damage to the timed effect of Red Stew Type: Passive Item Pool: Shop
genesis: When used, removes all your passive items and teleports you to Isaac's Bedroom For every passive item removed, you are given a choice of 3 random pedestal items from any item pool. Essentially you are rerolling all your items, but each new item you get to choose between 3 random options The bedroom also contains a random trinket, 2 chests, 2 sacks and Isaac's bed, which can be used to full heal your red heart health The only way to exit Isaac's bedroom is teleporting out or via the trapdoor, which takes you to the next floor. This will deviate you from the alt path if you are currently on it Type: Active Recharge time: One time use Item Pool: Devil Room, Greed Mode Angel Room
sharp key: +5 Keys Upon use, allows you to consume 1 key and fire it at an enemy, dealing significant damage The damage done by the key projectile pierces through enemies and scales with your damage upgrades Keys fired by this item can open doors, secret rooms and destroy objects in the room, such as rocks Cannot be used if you don't have any keys Type: Active Recharge time: Instant Item Pool: Shop
booster pack: Spawns 5 random tarot cards Type: Passive Item Pool: Boss Room, Shop
mega mush: When used, this item causes Isaac to become humongous for 30 seconds While huge, Isaac is invincible and can crush objects, doors and enemies For the duration of the effect this gives you a x4 Damage Multiplier and +2.0 Range Up, but your rate of fire goes way down Type: Active Recharge time: 12 rooms Item Pool: Item Room
knife piece 1: Combine with Knife Piece 2 to create a Knife which can be fired across the room, dealing 25 damage to any enemies it comes into contact with In the Downpour/Dross II, you will find a white flame somewhere, and a room with a mirror in it. Touching the white flame temporarily turns you into The Lost, but allows you to walk through the mirror into a mirrored version of this floor. You have the Holy Mantle effect to prevent one hit per room, but taking another hit will kill you. The Knife Piece 1 is located in the Item Room in the mirrored area. Returning back through the mirror door returns you back to normal again The mirrored floor rooms have respawned enemies, and allows you to optionally fight the Boss a second time for an extra item When combined with Knife Piece 2, can be used to stab the fleshy door in the Mausoleum II, which then leads to the Corpse floor and the Mother boss Type: Passive Item Pool: None (see above)
knife piece 2: Combine with Knife Piece 1 to create a Knife which can be fired across the room, dealing 25 damage to any enemies it comes into contact with In the Mines/Ashpit II, there's a room with a minecart and a broken track. Pressing 3 yellow buttons on the floor causes the minecart to be rideable. Following the path takes you to an abandoned mineshaft, which leads you to a pedestal with the Knife Piece. Taking it will cause Mom's Shadow to spawn and chase you. You must make it back through the path solving a few bomb puzzles while avoiding her, to get back to the regular floor. All your items and consumables are temporarily removed while in the abandoned mine The room to access Knife Piece 2 only appears if you have Knife Piece 1 already You can skip pressing the 3 yellow buttons if you have the ability to fly and have 2 bombs to force open the door When combined with Knife Piece 1, can be used to stab the fleshy door in the Mausoleum II, which then leads to the Corpse floor and the Mother boss Type: Passive Item Pool: None (see above)
death certificate: This is a one time use item that teleports you to an alternate floor, which contains every single item in the game The items are spread between several different rooms all on pedestals. You may take only one of the items, before being teleported back to where you were You may take only one of the items, before being teleported back to where you were It's literally every item, that includes items not in item pools life Knife Pieces Type: Active Recharge time: 1 time use Item Pool: Secret Room
bot fly: Gives you a robot fly familar that orbits around Isaac and fires shielded tears at incoming projectiles Counts as 1 of 3 fly items needed towards the Beelzebub transformation Type: Passive, Familiar Item Pool: Item Room, Key Beggar, Crane Game
meat cleaver: When used, the Meat Cleaver will split all enemies in the room into 2 smaller versions with ~40% health each For enemies that have multiple parts to them (e.g. Larry Jr.) it will split them into 2 smaller enemies with half the number of sections they used to have If the enemy normally has a mechanic that splits it (e.g. Teratoma, Envy) then Meat Cleaver will deal a lot of damage and trigger the splitting effect If the split enemy has low enough health, it will just die instead of splitting Type: Active Recharge time: 2 rooms Item Pool: Item Room
evil charm: +2 Luck Up Type: Passive Item Pool: Secret Room
dogma: +0.1 Speed Up +2.0 Damage Up Grants you the ability to fly This item isn't available in any item pools - you are automatically given it after defeating Dogma, just before The Beast sequence Type: Passive Item Pool: None
purgatory: While in a room with enemies, red cracks will appear on the floor in random locations Walking over the crack spawns a white soul familiar, that launches itself into the nearest enemy, exploding and dealing double your tear damage to everything near it Cracks will keep appearing but only one can exist in the room at a time Type: Passive Item Pool: Devil Room, Angel Room
stitches: While held, this item spawns a familiar that can be moved around using the arrow keys and deals 1.5 damage per tick to any enemies it touches When activated, you teleport, swapping places with wherever Stitches was positioned If used while stitches is on top of an enemy, it an be used to telefrag enemies, dealing a lot of damage Type: Active, Familiar Recharge time: 3 seconds Item Pool: Item Room
r key: When used, this item restarts the game and places you back on the first floor with all your currently collected items, similar to doing a Victory Lap The game timer does not reset Allows angel rooms to be found in the new run if a devil deal was taken in the first run In Greed Mode this item costs 99 coins Donation machines remain jammed if they were before using the R Key Type: Active Recharge time: Single use Item Pool: Secret Room
knockout drops: Isaac now has a chance to fire a fist instead of normal tears, which have a much higher knockback effect and confuse enemies for a few seconds Enemies that are knocked back will damage and knock back any enemy they are knocked into Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room
eraser: An active item that allows you to throw an eraser at any enemy, which will kill it and prevent it from appearing for the rest of the run Enemies that are erased create a puff of smoke instead of spawning Works on bosses, except it doesn't kill them it just deals 15 damage Can only be used once per floor - batteries also cannot be used to recharge it to bypass this restriction The first use will raise it above your head, then by pressing the fire button it will be thrown in that direction Type: Active Recharge time: 1 room (Can only be used once per floor) Item Pool: Shop, Crane Game
yuck heart: When used, this item will give you +1 Rotten Heart Rotten Hearts act as red hearts and each one you currently have spawns 2 blue flies upon successfully clearing a room Type: Active Recharge time: 6 rooms Item Pool: Item Room, Rotten Beggar
urn of souls: Enemies now create a soul upon death, which is automatically sucked into the Urn giving it +1 charge. Mini-bosses and bosses create 2-3 souls When activated, the urn can be fired as a high damage flamethrower in any direction A charge is consumed roughly every 0.5 seconds of use Multi-part enemies such as Envy or Teratoma create a soul per each part killed A maximum of 20 souls can be held in the urn at one time Type: Active Recharge time: None (see above) Item Pool: Angel Room
akeldama: With each shot fired, another bloody tear will spawn behind Isaac Spawning multiple tears will form a trail of tears that follow Isaac as he moves, bursting and dealing damage upon contact with enemies The effect from this item will only work while in a hostile room that contains at least 1 enemy Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room
magic skin: Upon use, this item consumes 1 heart container or 2 soul hearts and spawns one item pedestal from the current room's pool Every use gives a broken heart, meaning that slot is permanently broken and the maximum health limit is reduced by 1 for the rest of the run After 12 uses, Isaac dies instantly (this also applies to The Lost despite having no health) Magic Skin will continue to appear after finding it once if you are not still holding it - the chance for it to replace an item is 1 ÷ (12 - number of times used) up to a maximum of 50% Type: Active Recharge time: 6 rooms Item Pool: Shop, Red Chest, Curse Room
revelation: +2 Soul Hearts Grants you the ability to fly Holding the fire button charges up a light beam attack similar to Brimstone The light beam deals damage equal to your current tear damage per tick to any enemies touching it Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room, Angel Room, Library
consolation prize: When picked up, this item raises your lowest stat or gives you some of whichever consumable item is the lowest (+3 coins or +1 bomb or +1 key) Drops either a bomb, a key or 3 coins on the ground. This is decided by whatever you have the least of. Keys and bombs are equal to 3 coins for deciding which to give Type: Passive Item Pool: Boss Room, Golden Chest, Crane Game
tinytoma: Grants a large orbital that rotates around Isaac When the orbital takes a few hits, they split into two smaller ones After the smaller orbitals take another hit, they explode into 2 blue spiders This item will respawn after a period of time Type: Passive, Familiar Item Pool: Item Room
brimstone bombs: +5 Bombs Your bombs now explode and fire 4 Brimstone lasers in all cardinal directions Each brimstone laser deals 8 damage per tick for 13 total hits Type: Passive Item Pool: Devil Room, Bomb Beggar, Greed Mode Devil Room
4.5 volt: Active items no longer charge up as normal from clearing rooms Enemies taking damage now charges your item instead. This includes damage you deal, and environmental damage they take e.g. from Fireplaces Type: Passive Item Pool: Shop, Battery Beggar
fruity plum: Gives you a familiar which is a smaller version of the Plum boss, which sprays tears and propels itself around the room Deals contact damage to any enemies it runs into Type: Passive, Familiar Item Pool: Item Room, Key Beggar
plum flute: When used, this item calls a friendly version of the Plum boss to fight for you for 10 seconds It will jump to the nearest enemy, slam on the ground and fire tears around it, then propel itself around the room, dealing contact damage to any enemies it touches before disappearing Type: Active Recharge time: 4 rooms Item Pool: Item Room
star of bethlehem: Spawns a star with a white aura around it, that floats very slowly through each room, making its way towards the boss While standing inside the aura, you gain a big Tears Up and Damage Up The star continues to make its way through the floor, even if you aren't in the same room as it Type: Passive, Familiar Item Pool: Angel Room
cube baby: Gives you a baby in an ice cube, which can be kicked around the room by walking into it Enemies take damage from Cube Baby depending on how fast it was travelling when it hit them. Having a higher movement speed allows you to kick it harder Enemies hit by the cube while moving have a high chance to become frozen. Frozen enemies never unfreeze and are considered dead by the game. Kicking a frozen enemy will push it into the wall, where it shatters and fires ice shards everywhere (these can then freeze other enemies) Enemies touching the cube while it's not moving or moving slowly will become slowed for a few seconds, and take a small amount of damage Cube Baby and enemies frozen will block enemy shots Type: Passive, Familiar Item Pool: Item Room
vade retro: Enemies that die now spawn a red ghost, that floats in place of where the enemy died Activating the item causes all red ghosts in the room to explode, dealing damage to any enemies near them The explosion doesn't deal damage to Isaac The red ghosts can be moved around slightly by firing tears through them Type: Active Recharge time: Instant Item Pool: Angel Room
false phd: +1 Black Heart Identified all pills on pickup, and converts them to their worse counterparts (e.g. Stat Up becomes Stat Down) Any 'Stat down' pills you take give you a permanent +0.6 Damage Up Most other negative pills spawn a black heart when used, including R U A Wizard?, Amnesia, Bad Trip, ???, Paralysis, Retro Vision, I'm Excited Type: Passive Item Pool: Devil Room
spin to win: While held, gives you an orbital that blocks enemy shots and deals contact damage equal to 3.5 per tick When activated, the orbital will spin way faster and deal 11.3 damage per tick. Isaac will also gain +0.5 Speed Up while active Type: Active & Passive, Familiar Item Pool: Item Room
vasculitis: On death enemies now fire tears in random directions, which can damage other enemies Isaac doesn't take damage from the tears from this item Amount of tears generated appears to scale with enemy health Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room
giant cell: Every time you take damage, a tiny Isaac familiar will spawn, which follows you and shoots tears at nearby enemies that deal 1.3 Damage The mini-Isaacs stay with you between floors, but can die if they take too much damage Maximum number of mini-Isaacs is 16 at one time Mini-Isaac's keep some of the abilities and appearance that Isaac has - e.g. the ability to fly Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room, Greed Mode Item Room
tropicamide: +5.25 Range Up Tear Size Up Type: Passive Item Pool: Boss Room
card reading: At the beginning of all future floors, two portals will appear, that can take you to either the Boss room (Red portal), Item room (Yellow portal) or Secret room (Blue portal) Type: Passive Item Pool: Shop
quints: Every time an enemy dies, a random familiar spawns where it was killed for the rest of the room The familiar cannot move, but continues to do its usual abilities Some of the possible familiars include: Brother Bobby, Sister Maggy, Little Steven, Demon Baby, Multidimensional Baby, Freezing Baby, Rotten Baby, Harlequin Baby and many more Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room, Greed Mode Item Room
tooth and nail: Every 5 seconds you become spiky for a brief moment, and deal contact damage to enemies While in this state you have invincibility to damage Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room
binge eater: Causes all pedestal items to show up as rotating items, that swap between the spawned item and a HP up item every second. This allows you to choose between the item that originally spawned and a HP upgrade every time When you pick up an item that increases your maximum HP, you gain a temporary damage boost that slowly goes down over time. Starts at +3.6 damage and goes to 0 after 30 seconds This effect applies to all items, including those in the shop and devil room Type: Passive Item Pool: Secret Room
guppy's eye: Shows you to see the contents of chests, and items that will drop from fires and poops before you destroy them Counts as 1 of 3 cat items needed towards the Guppy transformation Type: Passive Item Pool: Devil Room, Red Chest
strawman: Spawns a Keeper familiar, that shoots triple tears and follows your exact movements as you walk The keeper has 3 health coins and can die if it takes enough damage. He can pick up coins to restore health Similar to other familiars of this kind, you can hold the drop key to cause him to stand still If he dies, his corpse turns into a few blue spiders. He won't respawn even if you move to a new floor Type: Passive, Familiar Item Pool: Secret Room
dad's note: Only found in the Mausoleum II boss room The item itself has no effect Type: Passive Item Pool: None (see above)
sausage: +1 HP +0.2 Speed Up +0.5 Tears Up +0.5 Damage Up +1.5 Range Up +0.16 Shot Speed Up +1 Luck Up Type: Passive Item Pool: Secret Room
options?: Clearing a room will spawn an extra reward, however only one can be picked up - the other one will disappear Type: Passive Item Pool: Shop
candy heart: Every red heart you pick up gives a small but permanent stat increase Randomly picks between +0.05 Tears Up, +0.15 or +0.3 Range Up, +0.02 or +0.04 Speed Up, +0.1 Luck Up, +0.04 Shot Speed Up Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room
a pound of flesh: This item causes Devil deals to cost money instead of hearts, and shop items to cost hearts instead of money Shop items cost heart containers, and pickups have spikes around them The Devil deal conversion rate is 1 heart container to 15 coins Devil deal items can be on discount similar to the shop, making it 1 heart container = 7 coins instead Type: Passive Item Pool: Devil Room, Demon Beggar
redemption: Every time you enter a devil room and choose not to take an item, you get +1 Damage Up upon entering the next floor The effect is shown via a cross above Isaac's head. Taking a Devil deal breaks the cross and prevents the damage up next floor Taking free pickups such as Black hearts in the Devil room also count Type: Passive Item Pool: None
spirit shackles: Type: Passive Item Pool: Secret Room
cracked orb: Taking damage reveals a random room on the minimap, and automatically opens certain doors in the current room. Possible doors include any needing a key to open (Item Room, Shop, Alt Path doors), secret rooms and crawl spaces Cracked Orb can also reveal the location of the red room that contains a pedestal item. The Red Key item is required to access it, but it shows the direction to get there Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room, Secret Room
empty heart: Adds an empty heart container at the start of each floor Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room, Demon Beggar
astral projection: The first time you get hit in each room, instead of taking damage Isaac will now temporarily die and become The Lost During this effect, time stops for 3 seconds allowing you to escape and get a few extra shots in Isaac returns to his body if you either clear the room or take damage while as The Lost Only happens once per room - taking damage a second time removes hearts as normal Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room, Secret Room
c section: Instead of tears, you have a baby that shoots out of Lilith and deals x3 your tear damage to enemies it hits The baby is attached via a cord, and returns to you while not pressing the fire button Holding the fire button causes the baby to shoot tears of its own. Alternatively you can spam press the fire button to whip the baby at enemies and deal more damage Tainted Lilith starts with this item Type: Passive Item Pool: None (Tainted Lilith only)
lil abaddon: Gives you a familiar that can be charged up to release a black ring, that damages any enemies that touch it with rapid hits (similar to Maw of the Void / Athame effects) The effect does a decent amount of damage, but doesn't scale with your damage upgrades Type: Passive, Familiar Item Pool: Devil Room
montezuma's revenge: While firing tears, you now charges up a poop attack for 3 seconds that when released, fires from Isaac's behind The poop attack deals your current tear damage to any enemies caught in the blast Counts as 1 of 3 poop items needed towards the Oh Crap transformation Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room
lil portal: Gives Isaac a little portal familiar, that moves across the screen as you're firing The portal will suck up any consumables and trinkets it travels over, causing it to become larger and deal more contact damage When the portal sucks up 4 pickups, it turns into a portal that can be used to teleport to unexplored rooms around the floor. It can take take you to rooms that require bombs/keys, e.g. the Secret Room or the Shop Every time the portal sucks up an item, it spawns a blue attack fly for you Once every room has been explored, the portal does nothing Cannot take you to rooms that aren't a part of the floor structure e.g. Devil Rooms / I AM ERROR rooms Type: Passive, Familiar Item Pool: Item Room
worm friend: You gain a familiar that lives under the floor. Every so often it will come up and attempt to grab onto a random enemy in the room, holding them in place and dealing damage The Worm Friend deals 4 damage for 8 ticks total If the enemy moves quickly enough it can miss its attack Type: Passive, Familiar Item Pool: Item Room
bone spurs: Enemies that die will leave behind 1-2 floating bone shards where they die, until you leave the room Other enemies that touch the bone shards will take 3.5 damage, with a chance to either bounce off them or cause it to break and disappear Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room
hungry soul: Each time an enemy dies, a friendly red soul appears. It will hunt down other enemies, dealing contact damage which scales with your tear damage After 5 seconds the red soul explodes (Isaac doesn't take damage from this effect) Type: Passive Item Pool: Devil Room
jar of wisps: When used, gives you number of blue flame orbitals based on the number shown over this item It starts at 1, and increments each activation, giving you more familiars each time you use it The flames fire tears at the same time Isaac does, that deal a flat 3 damage If a flame touches an enemy, it deals contact damage equal to double your current tear damage and then disappears You can have a maximum of 24 flame orbitals at once Each flame has a chance to spawn as one of many variants, such as green flames that poison enemies, or a crucifix flame that spawns a random horseman familiar + Locusts when it is extinguished Type: Active Recharge time: 12 rooms Item Pool: Angel Room
soul locket: +1 Soul Heart Soul hearts give you small permanent stat increases when picked up Possible stats include +0.3 Range Up, +0.2 Luck Up, +0.2 Damage Up, +0.1 Tears Up, +0.04 Speed Up Type: Passive Item Pool: Angel Room
friend finder: Spawns a random charmed enemy which fights by your side and copies your exact movements, similar to how Jacob & Esau work The familiars fire tears at the same time as Isaac, and have a visible health bar showing how much damage they can take before dying Type: Active Recharge time: 4 rooms Item Pool: Item Room, Crane Game
inner child: Gives you an extra life You respawn as a tiny version of Isaac, with a greatly reduced hitbox Type: Passive Item Pool: Secret Room
glitched crown: Item pedestals now cycle between 5 random items Type: Passive Item Pool: Secret Room
belly jelly: Enemies that touch Isaac will now bounce off him and fly off in the opposite direction Touching enemies still causes contact damage, however bounced enemies will die if they slam into the wall This item also gives a random chance for enemy shots to bounce off you without taking damage Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room
sacred orb: Increases the quality of generated items Rerolls items with a quality of 0 or 1 33% chance to reroll items with a quality of 2 Quality is a hidden mechanic in Repetance for all items and ranges from 0-4. Certain items consider Quality for picking what item to spawn, allowing better items to spawn under certain conditions Type: Passive Item Pool: Angel Room, Secret Room
sanguine bond: Spawns a special set of spikes in the Devil Room Taking damage from the spikes has a chance to spawn a reward 6 Pennies - 35% chance +0.5 Damage Up - 15% chance 2 Black Hearts - 5% chance Random Item - 2% chance Leviathan trasformation - 1% chance Type: Passive Item Pool: Devil Room, Curse Room
the swarm: When picked up, this gives you 9 orbital flies Each time a fly blocks an enemy shot, it will turn into a blue fly and attack nearby enemies, leaving you with one less orbital Every room clear gives you +1 orbital fly, up to a maximum of 9 Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room, Key Beggar
heartbreak: +0.75 Damage Up, and adds 3 'broken' heart containers The 'broken' heart containers mean the maximum health limit is reduced by 3 for the rest of the run, leaving you with a max total of 9 instead of the usual 12 Type: Passive Item Pool: Devil Room, Curse Room
bloody gust: Every time you take damage, you gain a Speed Up and a Tears Up The stat increases start small, and scale up each time you take damage (+0.25 Tears Up for the first hit, +0.75 Tears Up for the 6th hit) The effect maxes out at +3 Tears Up and +1 Speed Up after taking damage 6 times. This brings you to the maximum possible speed The effect lasts for the rest of the current floor Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room, Devil Room
salvation: Isaac gains a halo of light around him. When an enemy touches the halo for couple of seconds, a beam of light will come down and deal a burst of damage to it The triggered beam also fires in all 4 cardinal directions, dealing damage to anything it touches Every time an enemy is killed with this effect, the halo grows slightly bigger Type: Passive Item Pool: Angel Room
vanishing twin: A fetus familiar follows Isaac, and upon entering the Boss room on each floor, it will transform into a copy of the boss This makes bosses a lot harder, however you now get 2 boss item drops Type: Passive, Familiar Item Pool: Secret Room, Curse Room
twisted pair: You gain two familiar demons, that stay by Isaac's side and fire shots in the same direction as you The familiars deal roughly 40% of Isaac's damage, scaling with damage upgrades you get They sit near and rotate around Isaac depending on which way you're firing tears. They do not block enemy shots Type: Passive, Familiar Item Pool: Devil Room
azazel's rage: Isaac builds rage each time you clear a new room. This is shown by the Azazel skin spreading on Isaac's face After 4 rooms, Isaac's face will flash red. The next room you enter he will automatically fire a massive red brimstone laser for 4 seconds, dealing huge damage The rage resets back to zero, and the cycle continues every 5 rooms cleared Type: Passive Item Pool: Devil Room
echo chamber: When using a pill or card, Echo Chamber activates one of every pill type and card type that has been previously used since obtaining Echo Chamber Type: Passive Item Pool: Secret Room
isaac's tomb: Spawns a wooden chest at the start of all future floors The wooden chest can contain: 3 trinkets, 1-3 soul hearts, a random item from the Wooden Chest pool Type: Passive Item Pool: Secret Room
vengeful spirit: Each time you take damage, a red flame orbital will appear around Isaac for the remainder of the floor, up to a maximum of 6 The flames deal contact damage which scales with your tear damage Upon reaching 6 flames, they will also start to fire tears along with Isaac, dealing a flat 3.2 damage per tear When entering a new floor, all the flames disappear Type: Passive Item Pool: Devil Room, Curse Room
esau jr: Using this item swaps you between the character you started as, and Esau, which has 3 black hearts, +2 base damage and the ability to fly This character keeps its own separate health and items. Items picked up are not shared between the two characters If either character dies it's game over Type: Active Recharge time: 1 room Item Pool: Item Room, Secret Room
berserk!: When activated, Isaac gets a bone sword and goes on a killing rampage, gaining +0.4 Speed, +3 Flat Damage Up The sword deals x4 damage if used at close range, or x2 damage if charged up and thrown Clearing rooms doesn't charge this item - charge is added equal to damage taken by enemies. This includes all sources of damage, including environmental damage to enemies The bone sword from this item is similar to Donkey Jawbone from Antibirth Tainted Samson starts with a passive version of this item Type: Active Recharge time: Enemy damage taken = charge Item Pool: Devil Room
dark arts: When used, Isaac turns into a ghost for 1 second and his speed goes up to maximum (2.0). During this time he can walk over enemies to mark them for death. When the effect wears off, Isaac quickly runs between each marked enemy, dealing high damage to each one rapidly (roughly x2.5 your tear damage) The damage caused by this effect scales up with every target it hits in a row Tainted Judas starts with this item Type: Active Recharge time: 7 seconds Item Pool: Devil Room
abyss: When used, Abyss consumes all pedestal items in the current room and converts them into Red attack flies Red attack flies will charge across the room in the same direction Isaac is shooting, dealing contact damage to enemies equal to Isaac's tear damage The flies don't block enemy shots, but this also means they never die and stay with Isaac forever Tainted Apollyon starts with this item Type: Active Recharge time: 4 rooms Item Pool: Devil Room
supper: +1 HP Up Type: Passive Item Pool: Boss Room
stapler: +1.0 Damage Up Staples one of Isaac's eyes shut, meaning he only shoots tears from one eye. This means some effects such as R U A WIZARD pills only fire tears in one direction Type: Passive Item Pool: Boss Room
suplex!: When used, you charge forwards for a second. If you touch an enemy in that time, Isaac will pick it up and slam it on the ground, killing it and sending a shockwave around the impact In the brief period while holding the enemy you can move a target to decide where it lands Actually does work on bosses! However after the attack you end up near the boss, which puts you in danger of taking damage too Type: Active Recharge time: 8 seconds Item Pool: Item Room, Crane Game
bag of crafting: Can be used to store up to 8 consumables in, such as hearts, coins, keys, bombs, cards etc When the bag has 8 items you can hold down the activate button for 2 seconds to craft yourself a brand new item Each combination of pickups you hold in the bag will create a specific item. Check out the Mechanics > Bag of Crafting page to see combinations (Coming soon!) Has other uses - Will deal 3 damage to enemies it hits, and can be used to quickly push bombs and objects across rooms Tainted Cain starts with this item Type: Active Recharge time: Instant Item Pool: None
flip: Tainted Lazarus starts with this item - it doesn't appear in any item pools When used, this allows you to switch characters between Lazarus and Dead Lazarus. Each character keeps its own items and health Tainted Lazarus automatically swaps between these characters after clearing each room, but this item allows you to choose to manually swap if needed Type: Active Recharge time: 6 rooms Item Pool: None
lemegeton: When used, gives you an orbital flame which represents another passive item in the game. While you have this flame you also have that item's effect The flame deals double your tear damage to any enemies that touch it, but if it takes too much damage the flame will disappear and you lose the item's effect Tainted Bethany starts with this item Type: Active Recharge time: 6 rooms Item Pool: Devil Room, Library
sumptorium: Tainted Eve will passively spawn blood clot familiars while shooting tears, which consume 1/2 a red heart each time one is spawned. This can only take you down to a minimum of 0.5 total red hearts Sumptorium allows you to suck up all the blood clot familiars and convert them all back into red health Tainted Eve starts with this item Type: Active Recharge time: 3 seconds Item Pool: None (Tainted Eve only)
recall: Tainted Forgotten's Birthright effect. Cannot be obtained and has no use for any other character Birthright is a Shop item that has unique effects depending on what character you're playing as When used, this will send the Forgotten's skeleton head back to its owner's hands Type: Active Recharge time: 3 seconds Item Pool: None
hold: This is the item Tainted Blue Baby (???) uses as his main mechanic Killing or damaging enemies spawns various poops, which add to his collection. Pressing the bomb button will put the next poop into the 'Hold' jar. Pressing it again allows you to throw it at enemies. Each poop has random effects like Butt Bombs, Fire Poops etc Tainted Blue Baby starts with this item, and is the only one who can use it Type: Active Recharge time: Instant Item Pool: None
keeper's sack: Spawns 3 random coins and a key when picked up Buying items from the shop gives you random stat upgrades. The more you spend the higher the stat increase Possible stats include Speed, Damage and Range 15c items give all 3 stats: +1 Damage Up, +0.03 or +0.06 Speed Up, +0.25 or +0.5 Range Up 5c items give 1 or 2 stats: +0.5 Damage Up **OR** +0.25 Range and +0.03 Speed Up Type: Passive Item Pool: Shop, Secret Room
keeper's kin: Rocks and pots spawn 2 blue spiders when they are broken Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room, Secret Room
keeper's box: When used, spawns a random shop item or consumable, however you have to pay the relevant cost to pick it up Can include anything that would appear in the shop Type: Active Recharge time: 4 rooms Item Pool: Shop, Secret Room, Wooden Chest
everything jar:
With every bar of charge this item has, a different item is shown inside the Jar. Items start as poops/coins at low charge, moving up to 
        cards, pills and golden At the full 12 charges, a completely random effect will happen. It can be anything including spawning a bunch of consumables, spawning a glitched pedestal item, creating a bunch of light beams, spawning troll bombs or nothing at all Type: Active Recharge time: 12 rooms Item Pool: Item Room, Crane Game
tmtrainer: When picked up, all future items become 'glitched', causing them to become random combinations of 2-3 effects based on other items Glitched items can be passive or active and are completely randomly generated with infinite possibilities (similar to other 'Randomizer' games) Random effects combine effects that exist on other items, and assign them to a random event (e.g. on enemy death, on room clear, on damage taken etc.) Type: Passive Item Pool: Secret Room
anima sola: When used, it puts the closes enemy in chains for 5 seconds, preventing it from moving Tainted Jacob starts with this item Type: Active Recharge time: 15 seconds Item Pool: Item Room
spindown dice: Rerolls all pedestal items, lowering all their internal item IDs by 1 For example: Brimstone's ID = 118, so it would be rerolled into Dead Bird (ID = 117) Sad Onion (ID = 1) will reroll into nothing There are some gaps in item IDs which are skipped if no item exists, or will reroll into unexpected items if hidden items are present at that ID. For example rerolling Plan C (ID = 475) changes it into the Broken Glass Cannon, which is a hidden item with ID = 474 Items that are yet to be unlocked will also be skipped over, preventing you from getting items you don't have access to yet Type: Active Recharge time: 6 rooms Item Pool: Item Room, Secret Room, Crane Game
hypercoagulation: Upon taking damage you have a chance to drop the heart that you just lost. It gives you 2 seconds to pick it up again to re-heal, before it disappears Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room
ibs: Causes Isaac to throw a random type of poop, at random intervals An addition chance for Explosive Diarrhea to happen, which spawns 5 troll bombs where Isaac is standing Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room
hemoptysis: Allows you to quickly double tap a shoot button to sneeze on nearby enemies, dealing x1.5 your tear damage Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room
ghost bombs: +5 Bombs Bombs spawn a friendly white soul, which will hunt down other enemies, dealing contact damage which scales with your tear damage After 10 seconds the red soul explodes (Isaac doesn't take damage from this effect) Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room, Bomb Beggar
gello: When used, allows you to throw a familiar, which deals x3 your tear damage to any enemies it touches The familiar is attached via an Umbilical Cord, but will move and shoot in the same direction Isaac is shooting Can be used multiple times per room to spawn more familiars, however they only last for the current room Type: Active Recharge time: 2 rooms Item Pool: Item Room, Devil Room
decap attack: When used, this item allows you to throw your head where it will sit as a stationary sentry firing bullets until you walk over and pick it up again Throwing Isaac's head deals 24 damage to anything it hits Your hitbox remains with the body. Enemies touching the head don't hurt Isaac Type: Active Recharge time: 4 seconds Item Pool: Item Room,
jawbreaker: Tears have a chance to become a tooth, dealing more than triple damage
chewed pen: Tears have a chance to slow enemies
blessed penny: Chance to spawn half a soul heart when picking up a coin The chance scales up based on the coin's worth: Penny = 16.66%, Double Penny = 30.5%, Nickel = 59.7%, Dime = 83.3%
broken syringe: Gives you a random syringe effect every room The effect can be The Virus, Roid Rage, Speed Ball, Experimental Treatment, Synthoil, Euthanasia or Growth Hormones
short fuse: Placed bombs explode almost instantly This was called Exploded Firecracker in Antibirth
gigante bean: Farts produced by Isaac or familiars will be twice as large
a lighter: Chance for enemies to burn when entering a room The chance for this effect to activate is effected by your Luck stat
broken padlock: Explosions can open locked doors This includes key blocks and golden chests
myosotis: Pickups left on current floor will appear in the starting room of the next floor, up to a maximum of 4 pickups
'm: Active items will be rerolled upon using them Breath of Life is not rerolled by this trinket
teardrop charm: Random luck-based tear effects have an extra chance of occurring The additional chance is effectively +3 Luck Up
apple of sodom: Picking up red hearts now has a high chance to spawn 1-4 blue attack spiders, instead of giving you health back This effect also works while fully healed, giving a guaranteed chance of getting spiders While missing any red health the chance for spiders is less Works for characters that don't use red health, which always gives you spiders
forgotten lullaby: Gives your familiars improved rate of fire while held In Antibirth this trinket was called Song of the Siren
beth's faith: While held at the start of each floor, this trinket spawns four wisp familiar orbitals around Isaac These wisps are the same as the ones created by the Book of Virtues item
old capacitor: Your active item no longer gains charges, but battery drops become much more common
brain worm: Tears that miss enemies will redirect themselves and travel 90 degrees towards enemies Tears must be roughly 2 tiles or closer to activate this effect
perfection: +10 Luck while held, but the trinket is destroyed when damage is taken Blood donation machines and Curse Rooms wont destroy it Can be dropped in order to avoid breaking it This trinket is automatically given to you after clearing 3 bosses without taking damage
devil's crown: Treasure Rooms are replaced with Red Treasure Rooms, which contain a deal with the devil in place of a regular item pedestal If an item room as not yet been entered, it can be transformed to either a regular or Red Treasure Room by picking up or dropping this trinket before entering
charged penny: Every time you pick up a coin, you have a small chance to gain 1 bar of charge on your active item In Antibirth this trinket was called Electric Penny
friendship necklace: While held, your familiars will now orbit around Isaac instead of following behind him
panic button: If your active item is fully charged, when you take damage it will automatically activate It doesn't activate for free - the charges are used up as normal if this effect activates
blue key: Doors can be opened without using up a key However, when entering the door you are taken to a blue womb room with enemies to defeat. This room will always drop a reward at the end, then allow you to exit back to the real floor
flat file: While held this trinket causes spikes to retract into the floor Works for curse rooms - you no longer take damage entering or leaving
telescope lens: Allows a second Planetarium to spawn Planetarium have a base 1% chance to appear, which increases by +20% whenever you skip an Item Room (Must not enter to count as skipped)
mom's lock: Has a high chance to give you the effect of a random Mom item every room
dice bag: Every time you enter a brand new room, you have a chance to get a random one-time use Dice (e.g. D6, D6, D20 etc.)
holy crown: Causes Item rooms to appear in the Cathedral
mother's kiss: While held you get +1 HP Up The first time you pick this trinket up, the heart container will be filled. This effect can't be abused - next time it will be empty if dropped
torn card: Every 15 shots you will shoot an Ipecac + My Reflection shot The tear will fly in the air for about 3 seconds and follows Isaac until it falls and explodes. You need to move out of the way or it will hurt Isaac, but can be used to open anything requiring a bomb e.g. Secret Rooms
torn pocket: Every time you take damage, you drop up to 2 different types of consumables on the ground Dropped consumables can be any variant of its kind - e.g. a bomb can become a troll bomb, or a dropped coin can become a dime Does nothing if you have no consumables
gilded key: All new chests become locked Golden chests
lucky sack: Spawns a sack at the start of each new floor
wicked crown: Causes Item rooms to appear in Sheol
azazel's stump: When entering a new room, gives a small chance to gain Azazel's short-range Brimstone laser for the current room and the ability to fly
dingle berry: Spawns 2 friendly Dips upon clearing a room Dips that spawn after killing a Squirt turn friendly
ring cap: Drops 2 bombs at once (only 1 bomb is removed from your total)
nuh uh!: Beyond the womb floor, all pickups are replaced with a random pickup as follows: Bomb - 26.6% chance. Heart - 26.6% chance Pill - 26.6% chance. Card - 26.6% chance Trinket - 26.6% chance. Battery - 26.6% chance Essentially just removes keys from the drop table
modeling clay: Each brand new room, this trinket has a chance to transform into a copy of a random passive item, which gives you the effect for the duration of this room
polished bone: Gives a small chance to spawn a friendly Bony when clearing a room, which will throw bones at enemies until it takes enough damage to die. Max 3 Bonys at once
hollow heart: Gives you +1 Bone Heart every time you enter a new floor
kid's drawing: Counts as 1 of 3 cat items needed towards the Guppy transformation Dropping this trinket again removes the transformation if you dont have 3 other Guppy items
crystal key: Sometimes creates Red Key rooms, which appear in gaps on the map This room can be of many types, including but not limited to any regular room from that floor, treasure rooms, curse rooms or devil rooms
keeper's bargain: Has a decent chance for Devil Deals to cost money instead of Health The conversion rate is 1 heart container to 15 coins Items can be on discount similar to the shop, making it 1 heart container = 7 coins instead Can be dropped to disable this effect while in the room
cursed penny: While held, you will be teleported to a random room everytime you pick up a coin
your soul: Allows you to pay for a devil deal with this trinket
strange key: Opens the door to the Blue Womb, regardless of whether you meet the 30 minute speed timer
lil clot: A small clot friend will hug Isaac, following his exact movements (similar to how Jacob & Esau work) and shooting tears when he does The clot can be moved around by collision with an object/wall, allowing you to re-position it The clot's damage is roughly 1/3 of your tear damage If it takes a few hits it will die, and respawn in the next room
temporary tattoo: Spawns a random chest after completing a regular Challenge Room Spawns a pedestal item after completing a boss Challenge Room
swallowed m80: When taking damage you have a chance to explode and deal 185 damage to all enemies around you (Same damage as a Mr. Mega bomb)
rc remote: Familiars follow Isaac's exact movements, (similar to how Jacob & Esau work) instead of following loosely like they usually do Holding the drop button (Ctrl on Steam version) causes them to stop moving Doesn't affect some familiars with specific movement patterns, e.g. Abel
found soul: Gives you a familiar that follows Isaac's exact movements (similar to how Jacob & Esau work) and shoots spectral tears Similar to Jacob and Esau, positions can be altered by running it into objects, or holding the drop button (Ctrl on Steam version) When you place a bomb, the Found Soul will drop one too If it takes any damage, it will die and not respawn until the next floor
expansion pack: Everytime you use your active item, you have a chance to activate another random active item
beth's essence: Taking damage gives you a chance to spawn a flame orbital, similar to the ones created by Book of Virtues Entering an Angel Room gives you +5 flame orbitals. The angel room spawned by The Stairway item also counts Giving money to a beggar gives a flame orbital
the twins: Chance to spawn either Brother Bobby or Sister Maggy when entering each new room Only lasts for the current room
adoption papers: All shops only sell familiars while holding this trinket If you enter a shop while holding this trinket, the effect won't undo by dropping it until you move to a new floor
cricket leg: Every time an enemy dies you have a chance to gain a random Locust Different color Locusts correspond to the horsemen. Each of them deal double your tear damage, similar to how standard blue flies work War (Red) - Explodes when touching the enemy. The actual explosion deals flat 60 damage Pestilence (Green) - Poisons the enemy it attacks Famine (Brown) - Applies a slowing effect Death (Black) - Deals x4 damage instead of x2 Conquest (White) - Spawns 2-5 at once
apollyon's best friend: Gives you a red attack fly, that will charge at enemies in the same direciton you are shooting Deals damage equal to your current tear damage Stops charging once it hits an enemy and returns to Isaac's side
broken glasses: Gives a 33% chance to spawn an extra blind pedestal item in all future item rooms. This one will be a hidden question mark Allows you to see what both items are on alternative path floors (Downpour/Dross, Mines/Ashpit, Gehenna/Mausoleum)
ice cube: Gives a small chance for your tears to freeze enemies in place Frozen enemies can be pushed into obstacles where they shatter on contact and fire ice shards around them. Any other enemies hit by these shards will become frozen too Frozen enemies are considered dead by the game, and won't unfreeze or move again. The room doors will open if only frozen enemies remain
sigil of baphomet: Every time you kill an enemy you get an invincibility shield for 2 seconds
the sad onion: +0.7 Tears Up Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room
the inner eye: Tears now shoot three at a time (Triple Shot) Tears Down significantly (tears = tears * 2.1 + 3) Type: Passive, Tear Modifier Item Pool: Item Room
spoon bender: Gives Isaac's tears a homing effect REPENTANCE - Homing tears now target enemies much more reliably Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room
cricket's head: +0.5 Damage Up x1.5 times Damage Multiplier (Does not stack with the Magic Mushroom multiplier) Can be found in golden chests Cricket's Head used to be known as Max's Head in the original game and was renamed for Rebirth Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room, Gold Chest
my reflection: Gives tears a boomerang effect +1.5 Range Up +0.6 Shot Speed Up +1 Tear Height Type: Passive, Tear Modifier Item Pool: Item Room
number one: Gives you a very high tear rate in exchange for a big range down +1.5 Tears Up -17.62 Range Down +0.76 Tear Height Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room
blood of the martyr: +1.0 Damage Up x1.5 times Damage Multiplier if you also have Book of Belial (Does not stack with Magic Mushroom or Cricket's Head multipliers) Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room
brother bobby: A familiar which follows Isaac and shoots normal tears which do 3.5 damage Counts as 1 of 3 familiar items needed towards the Conjoined transformation REPENTANCE - Brother Bobby now has an increased rate of fire Type: Passive, Familiar Item Pool: Item Room, Devil Room
skatole: A lot of fly enemies are no longer aggressive towards Isaac Attack Fly, Dart Fly, Eternal Fly, and Ring Fly are transformed into a neutral black fly Boom Fly, Red Boom Fly, Drowned Boom Fly move slower, but still deal contact damage Moter, Level 2 Fly, Full Fly, Pooter, and Super Pooter move slower and deal no contact damage Can only be obtained from the shell game in the arcade Counts as 1 of 3 fly items needed towards the Beelzebub transformation Type: Passive Item Pool: None (Arcade shell game only)
halo of flies: Gives Isaac 2 orbital flies which block enemy shots Picking up this item as well as 2 other fly-type items will allow you to transform into Lord of the Flies Counts as 1 of 3 fly items needed towards the Beelzebub transformation Type: Passive, Orbital Item Pool: Item Room, Key Beggar
1up: Gives the player an extra life When revived, the green mushroom that follows Isaac will disappear and he will respawn with the same amount of red heart containers at full health Resurrection takes place before all other items which give you an extra life Type: Passive Item Pool: Secret Room
magic mushroom: +1 Health Up +0.3 Damage Up x1.5 times Damage Multiplier (Does not stack with the multipliers from Cricket's Head / Blood of The Martyr + Book of Belial) +5.25 Range Up +0.3 Speed Up +0.5 Tear Height Increases the size of your player sprite, but doesn't increase the hitbox Fully restores all red heart containers Counts as 1 of 3 mushroom items needed towards the Fun Guy transformation Counts as 1 of 3 size-increasing items needed towards the Stompy transformation Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room, Boss Room, Mushrooms
the virus: Deals poison damage on contact with enemies (Damage over time 4 or 6 per tick) Has a chance to drop from the Lust miniboss fight Counts as 1 of 3 syringe items needed towards the Spun transformation REPENTANCE - +0.2 Speed Up (Used to be -0.1 Speed before Repentance). No longer drops black hearts like it used to Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room, Demon Beggar, Lust Miniboss
roid rage: +0.6 Speed Up +5.25 Range Up +0.5 Shot Height Counts as 1 of 3 syringe items needed towards the Spun transformation Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room, Boss Room, Demon Beggar
<3: +1 Health Up Fully restores all red heart containers Has a chance to drop from the Gluttony miniboss fight Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room, Boss Room, Gluttony Miniboss
raw liver: +2 Health Up Full red heart heal Type: Passive Item Pool: Secret Room
skeleton key: Gives Isaac 99 Keys Type: Passive Item Pool: Secret Room
a dollar: Gives Isaac 99 coins Can drop from an exploding slot machine while playing it Type: Passive Item Pool: None (Arcade machine only)
boom!: +10 Bombs Type: Passive Item Pool: Item Room, Bomb Beggar
transcendence: Gives Isaac the ability to fly Type: Passive Item Pool: Secret Room
the compass: Shows most icons on the map (Shops, Item Rooms, Boss Rooms etc.) Does not show the layout of the map Doesn't show the location of Secret or Super Secret rooms Room icons will not show if a Curse of the Lost is in effect on the current floor Type: Passive Item Pool: Shop, Beggar
lunch: +1 Health Up Type: Passive Item Pool: Boss Room, Challenge Room, Beggar
dinner: +1 Health Up Type: Passive Item Pool: Boss Room, Beggar, Challenge Room
dessert: +1 Health Up Type: Passive Item Pool: Boss Room, Beggar, Challenge Room
breakfast: +1 Health Up Type: Passive Item Pool: Boss Room, Challenge Room, Beggar
rotten meat: +1 Health Up Type: Passive Item Pool: Boss Room, Beggar, Challenge Room
wooden spoon: +0.3 Speed Up Type: Passive Item Pool: Boss Room
the belt: +0.3 Speed Up REPENTANCE - Added back to the Gold Chest pool Type: Passive Item Pool: Boss Room, Gold Chest
mom's underwear: +1.5 Range Up Gives 3-6 blue attack flies when picked up Counts as 1 of 3 mom items needed towards the Mom transformation Type: Passive Item Pool: Boss Room, Challenge Room
mom's heels: +1.5 Range Up Counts as 1 of 3 mom items needed towards the Mom transformation REPENTANCE - Touching enemies deals 12 damage to them Type: Passive Item Pool: Boss Room, Challenge Room
mom's lipstick: +2.25 Range Up Drops a random heart on the floor when picked up Counts as 1 of 3 mom items needed towards the Mom transformation Type: Passive Item Pool: Boss Room, Challenge Room
wire coat hanger: +0.7 Tears Up Type: Passive Item Pool: Boss Room
the bible: Gives Isaac angel wings for the current room, allowing him to fly Instantly kills the Mom's Foot, Mom's Heart and It Lives boss fights If used during the Satan fight, The Bible will instantly kill Isaac Counts as 1 of 3 angel items needed towards the Seraphim transformation Counts as 1 of 3 book items needed towards the Bookworm transformation REPENTANCE - Reduced to 4 room recharge time Type: Active Recharge Time: 4 rooms Item Pool: Shop, Library, Angel Room
the book of belial: Upon use, gives +2 damage up which lasts for the current room x1.5 times Damage Multiplier if you also have Blood of the Martyr (Does not stack with Magic Mushroom or Cricket's Head multipliers) Increases your chances of getting a devil/angel room by +12.5% Judas starts with this item The effect stacks if used multiple times Counts as 1 of 3 book items needed towards the Bookworm transformation Type: Active Recharge Time: 3 rooms Item Pool: Library, Devil Room
the necronomicon: Deals 40 damage to everything in the room when used Counts as 1 of 3 book items needed towards the Bookworm transformation REPENTANCE - Reduced to 3 room recharge time Type: Active Recharge Time: 3 rooms Item Pool: Library, Secret Room, Devil Room
the poop: Drops a poop on the floor Blue Baby starts with this item Can be placed next to a pit and exploded to make a bridge Can be placed over a broken red poop to overwrite it, causing it to no longer regenerate Counts as 1 of 3 poop items needed towards the Oh Crap transformation Type: Active Recharge Time: 1 room Item Pool: Item Room
mr. boom: Drops a large bomb below the player which does 185 damage Compatible with bomb modifiers, such as Glitter Bombs, Sticky Bombs etc Has a chance to drop from the Wrath miniboss fight REPENTANCE - Damage buffed from 110 to 185 Type: Active Recharge Time: 2 rooms Item Pool: Item Room, Wrath Miniboss, Bomb Beggar
tammy's head: Fires 10 tears in a circle around Isaac Each tear is equal to your damage stat + 25 flat damage The tears spawned from Tammy's Head retain tear effects of Isaac's tears, such as poison or homing Synergizes extremely well with Brimstone due to how the damage from both items is calculated when combined Type: Active Recharge Time: 1 room Item Pool: Gold Chest
mom's bra: When used, freezes all enemies in the current room for about 4 seconds Counts as 1 of 3 mom items needed towards the Mom transformation Type: Active Recharge Time: 3 rooms Item Pool: Item Room, Challenge Room
kamikaze: Causes an explosion near Isaac which takes away half a heart and does 40 damage all enemies in close proximity REPENTANCE - No longer reduces your devil/angel room chances when used Type: Active Recharge Time: Instant Item Pool: Item Room
mom's pad: When used, causes all enemies in the current room to run away from Isaac in fear for 5 seconds Counts as 1 of 3 mom items needed towards the Mom transformation Type: Active Recharge Time: 3 rooms Item Pool: Item Room, Challenge Room
bob's rotten head: A poison bomb which can be thrown and leaves a poison effect on any enemies within the blast radius.
